person.persName: Clayton Gilliam (Trigg County, Kentucky, farmer and juror)

body.p: Trigg County, Kentucky, farmer and juror. Virginia native. Married to Frances E. Dupuy Gilliam. Father of Henry A. Gilliam, William A. Gilliam, and Clifton Gilliam. Resident in Prince Edward County, Virginia, in 1840. Owned two enslaved persons in Prince Edward County in 1840. Farmer in Appomattox County in 1850. Owned eight enslaved persons in Appomattox County in 1850. Resident in Trigg County, Kentucky, in 1855. Owned two enslaved persons in Trigg County in 1855. Resident in Trigg County in 1857. Juror in the Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Thomas B. Wadlington in Caldwell County, Kentucky, on December 8, 1860. Resident in Caldwell County in 1865.
